FolderDefinition.name: High
FolderDefinition.description: This folder contains issues that are critical to the application's security and should be immediately addressed

FolderDefinition.name: Medium
FolderDefinition.description: This folder contains issues that are important to address

FolderDefinition.name: Low
FolderDefinition.description: This folder provides a comprehensive list of issues in the application including code quality issues

TagDefinition.name: Analysis
TagDefinition.Description: The analysis tag must be set for an issue to be counted as 'Audited.' This is encouraged to be the final action performed by an auditor.

TagDefinition.name: SCR Analysis
TagDefinition.Description: This tag indicates how this issue was disposition in the previous code review

TagDefinition.name: SCR Suppress
TagDefinition.Description: This tag indicates how whether this issue was suppressed in the fpr file that was submitted for the code review

FilterSet.Title: Broad
FilterSet.Description: This setting provides the source code analyzer with the most comprehensive set of rules. It should be used to discover a broad set of security issues to be audited. Fortify SCA assigns issues a severity level based on the potential impact the issue could have on the security of an application. The engine also assigns a confidence level to further prioritize issues of the same severity. This set of filters uses these two attributes in order to sort the issues into three folders: Hot, Warning, and Info.

FilterSet.Title: Medium
FilterSet.Description: This setting provides the source code analyzer with rules that strike a balance between producing results that detail all potential issues and a targeted set of possible vulnerabilities. Fortify SCA assigns issues a severity level based on the potential impact the issue could have on the security of an application. The engine also assigns a confidence level to further prioritize issues of the same severity. This set of filters uses these two attributes in order to sort the issues into three folders: Hot, Warning, and Info.

FilterSet.Title: Targeted
FilterSet.Description: This setting provides the source code analyzer with rules within categories that have been proven to be high priority issues across multiple industries and within a variety of environments. They should be used to discover a limited set of well-known, critical security issues. Fortify SCA assigns issues a severity level based on the potential impact the issue could have on the security of an application. The engine also assigns a confidence level to further prioritize issues of the same severity. This set of filters uses these two attributes in order to sort the issues into three folders: Hot, Warning, and Info.

FilterSet.Title: Developer
FilterSet.Description: Fortify SCA assigns issues a severity level based on the potential impact the issue could have on the security of an application. The engine also assigns a confidence level to further prioritize issues of the same severity. This set of filters uses these two attributes in order to sort the issues into three folders: Hot, Warning, and Info.

FilterSet.Title: SCR
FilterSet.Description: Based on Broad but blocks all rules as defined in the Playbook.

Filter.query: category:"asp.net bad practices\: non-serializable object stored in session"
category:"poor error handling\: empty catch block"
category:poor error handling\: program catches null
category:"poor error handling\: return inside finally"
category:"code correctness\: null argument to equals"
category:"poor style\: identifier contains dollar symbol ($)"
category:"poor logging practice\: logger not declared static final"
category:"unsafe mobile code\: public finalize() method"
category:"code correctness\: class does not implement cloneable"
taint:httprs, web, xss [fortify priority order]:!high analyzer:data flow

FilterSet.Title: wfDeveloper
FilterSet.Description: This template enables the Wells Fargo developer to focus their attention on findings that are likely to result in moderate or higher risk ratings in a Security Plan.

Filter.query: category:"asp.net bad practices\: non-serializable object stored in session"
category:"poor error handling\: empty catch block"
category:poor error handling\: program catches null
category:"poor error handling\: return inside finally"
category:"code correctness\: null argument to equals"
category:"poor style\: identifier contains dollar symbol ($)"
category:"poor logging practice\: logger not declared static final"
category:"unsafe mobile code\: public finalize() method"
taint:httprs, web, xss [fortify priority order]:!high analyzer:data flow

FilterSet.Title: RCIS
FilterSet.Description: This setting provides the source code analyzer with the most comprehensive set of rules. It should be used to discover a broad set of security issues to be audited. Fortify SCA assigns issues a severity level based on the potential impact the issue could have on the security of an application. The engine also assigns a confidence level to further prioritize issues of the same severity. This set of filters uses these two attributes in order to sort the issues into three folders: Hot, Warning, and Info.
